Race.SpecificTitle: Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  2, District  3
PW- Metro Council -- 1/2% S.Tax & 9.9 Mills -Metro Council- 30 Yrs
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition

Summary:  Authority for the Parish of East Baton Rouge Capital Improvements District (A) to levy a 1/2% sales tax and (B) 9.9 mills property tax, each for a period of thirty (30) years, to provide funds for certain capital improvement projects within the Parish of East Baton Rouge, and authorizing the proceeds of such taxes to be funded into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge Capital Improvements District (the "District"), a special taxing district with geographical boundaries coterminous with the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29(B) of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution (the "Constitution"), Article VI, Section 19 of the Constitution, La. R.S. 33:2740.9, and other constitutional and statutory authority, (A) be authorized to levy and collect an additional tax of 1/2% (the "Sales Tax") (an estimated $39,600,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Sales Tax for an entire year), upon the sale at retail, the use, lease or rental, consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property (but exempting food and prescription drugs), and on sales of services in the District, commencing on January 1, 2009, to and including December 31, 2038, and (B) be authorized to levy and collect an ad valorem tax of 9.9 mills (the "Property Tax") (an estimated $29,000,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Property Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the District, for a period of thirty (30) years, commencing in the year 2009, to and including the year 2038, and shall proceeds of said Sales Tax and said Property Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Sales Tax and the Property Tax), be used entirely and exclusively to provide funding for certain capital improvement projects to be located within the geographical boundaries of the Parish, all as more specifically set forth in the Parish of East Baton Rouge Capital Improvements Plan dated July 23, 2008 ("Plan"); and shall the District be further authorized to fund proceeds of the Sales Tax and the Property Tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more of the capital improvements projects set forth in the Plan?
